summary: This is an internal NSD (National Security Division) Daily News Brief dated December 11, 2017, summarizing news articles from the Attorney General's briefing. It covers topics including the Russia investigation, FBI personnel changes, congressional probes, and various national security issues. A notable mention is that opposition research firm Fusion GPS attempted to link Donald Trump to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeff Sessions
persons.context: Subject of an FBI email regarding disclosure of foreign contacts for his security clearance; held a drug policy roundtable focusing on marijuana.

persons.name: Peter Strzok
persons.context: Removed from special counsel Robert Mueller's team after allegedly sending anti-Trump, pro-Clinton text messages; accused by Republicans of bias.

persons.name: Robert Mueller
persons.context: Leading the Russia investigation; his team's integrity is questioned by Republicans following revelations about Strzok and Weissman.

persons.name: Andrew Weissman
persons.context: Member of Mueller's team who sent an email praising Sally Yates for defying Trump's travel ban, cited as evidence of anti-Trump bias.

persons.name: Sally Yates
persons.context: Praised by Andrew Weissman for defying President Trump's travel ban executive order.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Allies use revelations about Mueller's team to push back against Russia investigation; discussed in context of obstruction allegations and his son's testimony.

persons.name: James Comey
persons.context: His firing is discussed in the context of obstruction allegations; his handling of Clinton and Trump investigations is compared.

persons.name: Hillary Clinton
persons.context: Referenced in the context of Peter Strzok's alleged pro-Clinton texts and the FBI's investigation into her private email server.

persons.name: Adam Schiff
persons.context: Criticized Republicans for trying to discredit Mueller and institutions; stated evidence of Trump campaign-Russia coordination is 'pretty damning.'

persons.name: Donald Trump Jr.
persons.context: Interviewed by the House Intelligence Committee; considered using attorney-client privilege regarding conversations with his father about a 2016 Trump Tower meeting.

persons.name: George Papadopoulos
persons.context: Pleaded guilty to lying to the FBI about efforts to connect the Trump campaign with Russian officials; had high-level access in Greece.

persons.name: Glenn Simpson
persons.context: Reportedly pitched stories to journalists attempting to link Donald Trump to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of a story pitched by Fusion GPS to link him to Donald Trump; described as a convicted pedophile and former friend of Bill Clinton.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned as having been buddies with convicted pedophile Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Chuck Grassley
persons.context: Clashing with Democrats over the direction of Russia and Clinton probes; accused Democrats of having a double standard.

persons.name: Sheldon Whitehouse
persons.context: Questioned a Republican senator allegedly 'nudged' by the White House to probe Fusion GPS.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Testified before the House Judiciary Committee; criticized for stonewalling but also praised for defending the FBI's integrity.

persons.name: Jim Jordan
persons.context: Suggested Peter Strzok used the Clinton-funded dossier to obtain a surveillance warrant on the Trump campaign.

persons.name: Jim Himes
persons.context: Stated the House Intelligence Committee may subpoena Donald Trump Jr. to get more answers.

persons.name: Peter King
persons.context: Said based on Trump Jr.'s interview, there was no indication of collusion between the Trump campaign and Russia.

persons.name: David Archey
persons.context: Veteran FBI agent who joined Mueller's team after Strzok's removal; described as a 'utility man' within the FBI.

persons.name: Jeanine Pirro
persons.context: Called for a 'cleansing' at the FBI and DOJ, naming several officials she said were protecting Clinton or destroying Trump.

connections.description: Fusion GPS reportedly pitched stories to journalists attempting to link Trump to Epstein, a convicted pedophile.
Described in the document as having been 'buddies' in the past.
Strzok was an investigator on Mueller's special counsel team before being removed.
Father and son; Trump Jr. was interviewed about conversations with his father regarding a Trump Tower meeting.
Simpson's firm, Fusion GPS, pitched stories attempting to link Trump to Epstein.
Both were members of special counsel Robert Mueller's investigation team.

events.title: NSD Daily News Brief
events.description: Internal National Security Division news briefing summarizing media reports on the Russia investigation, FBI, and national security.

events.title: CNN Reports on FBI Email re: Sessions
events.description: CNN reports on an FBI email stating Attorney General Jeff Sessions was not required to disclose certain foreign contacts for his security clearance.

events.title: Papadopoulos Plea Deal
events.description: George Papadopoulos pleaded guilty to lying to the FBI about efforts to connect the Trump campaign with Russian officials.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to soliciting sex from an underage girl.

events.title: Trump Tower Meeting
events.description: Donald Trump Jr. met with a Russian lawyer at Trump Tower, a subject of congressional inquiry.

keyFacts: Fusion GPS, the opposition research firm behind the Trump-Russia dossier, also pitched stories to journalists attempting to link Donald Trump to convicted pedophile Jeffrey Epstein.
An FBI email from March 2017 stated Attorney General Jeff Sessions was not required to disclose foreign contacts occurring in his official capacity for his security clearance.
FBI agent Peter Strzok was removed from special counsel Robert Mueller's team after allegedly sending anti-Trump, pro-Clinton text messages.

Donald Trump Jr. invoked attorney-client privilege during a House Intelligence Committee interview to avoid describing conversations with his father about the 2016 Trump Tower meeting with a Russian lawyer.
The internal NSD briefing warns employees to be cautious of media outlets reporting potentially classified documents and provides instructions for clearing internet cache.
